chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
Z': Type
Y': Type
X': Type
Z: Type
Y: Type
X: Type
RY: relation2 Y Y'
RX: relation2 X X'
R1: relation2 X Y
R2: relation2 Y Z
RZ: relation2 Z Z'
S1: relation2 X' Y'
S2: relation2 Y' Z'
H1: diagram RX R1 RY S1
H2: diagram RY R2 RZ S2

Goal:
diagram RX (comp R1 R2) RZ (comp S1 S2)

Premises:
diagram : forall X X' Y Y' : Type, relation2 X X' -> relation2 X Y -> relation2 Y Y' -> relation2 X' Y' -> Prop
comp : forall X Y Z : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 Y Z -> relation2 X Z
relation2 = fun X Y : Type => X -> Y -> Prop : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments relation2 (_ _)%type_scope
diagram_reverse : forall (X X' Y Y' : Type) (RX : relation2 X X') (R : relation2 X Y) (RY : relation2 Y Y') (R' : relation2 X' Y'), diagram RX R RY R' -> diagram R RX R' RY
diagram_incl : forall (X X' Y Y' : Type) (RX : relation2 X X') (R R' : relation2 X Y) (RY : relation2 Y Y') (S S' : relation2 X' Y'), diagram RX R RY S -> (forall (x : X) (y : Y), R' x y -> R x y) -> (forall (x : X') (y : Y'), S x y -> S' x y) -> diagram RX R' RY S'
comp_assoc : forall (X Y Z : Type) (R : relation2 X Y) (S : relation2 Y Z) (W : Type) (U : relation2 Z W), eeq (comp (comp R S) U) (comp R (comp S U))
comp_incl : forall (X Y Z : Type) (R' : relation2 X Y) (S' : relation2 Y Z) (R : relation2 X Y) (S : relation2 Y Z), incl R R' -> incl S S' -> incl (comp R S) (comp R' S')
comp_eeq : forall (X Y Z : Type) (R' : relation2 X Y) (S' : relation2 Y Z) (R : relation2 X Y) (S : relation2 Y Z), eeq R R' -> eeq S S' -> eeq (comp R S) (comp R' S')
inv_comp : forall (X Y Z : Type) (R : relation2 X Y) (S : relation2 Y Z), eeq (trans (comp R S)) (comp (trans S) (trans R))
union2 : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y
trans : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 Y X
eta2 : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y
union2_eeq : forall (X Y : Type) (R' R1' R R1 : relation2 X Y), eeq R R' -> eeq R1 R1' -> eeq (union2 R R1) (union2 R' R1')
union2_incl : forall (X Y : Type) (R' R1' R R1 : relation2 X Y), incl R R' -> incl R1 R1' -> incl (union2 R R1) (union2 R' R1')
union : forall X Y I : Type, (I -> X -> Y -> Prop) -> relation2 X Y
eeq_refl : forall (X Y : Type) (R : relation2 X Y), eeq R R
incl_refl : forall (X Y : Type) (R : relation2 X Y), incl R R
eeq_sym : forall (X Y : Type) (S R : relation2 X Y), eeq R S -> eeq S R
trans_incl : forall (X Y : Type) (R' R : relation2 X Y), incl R R' -> incl (trans R) (trans R')
trans_eeq : forall (X Y : Type) (R' R : relation2 X Y), eeq R R' -> eeq (trans R) (trans R')
inv_union2 : forall (X Y : Type) (R R' : relation2 X Y), eeq (trans (union2 R R')) (union2 (trans R) (trans R'))
inv_union : forall (I X Y : Type) (F : I -> relation2 X Y), eeq (trans (union F)) (union (fun i : I => trans (F i)))
relation = fun X : Type => relation2 X X : Type -> Type Arguments relation _%type_scope
eeq_trans : forall (X Y : Type) (S R T : relation2 X Y), eeq R S -> eeq S T -> eeq R T
incl_trans : forall (X Y : Type) (S R T : relation2 X Y), incl R S -> incl S T -> incl R T
union_incl : forall (I X Y : Type) (F' F : I -> relation2 X Y), (forall i : I, incl (F i) (F' i)) -> incl (union F) (union F')
union_eeq : forall (I X Y : Type) (F' F : I -> relation2 X Y), (forall i : I, eeq (F i) (F' i)) -> eeq (union F) (union F')
union_st : forall X Y : Type, set (relation2 X Y) -> X -> Y -> Prop
eeq : forall X Y : Type, relation (relation2 X Y)
incl : forall X Y : Type, relation (relation2 X Y)
comp_star_star : forall (X : Type) (T : relation X), eeq (comp (star T) (star T)) (star T)
comp_star_plus : forall (X : Type) (T : relation X), eeq (comp (star T) (plus T)) (plus T)
comp_plus_star : forall (X : Type) (T : relation X), eeq (comp (plus T) (star T)) (plus T)
plus : forall X : Type, relation X -> relation X
commute : forall X : Type, relation X -> relation X -> Prop
local_commute : forall X : Type, relation X -> relation X -> Prop
strong_commute : forall X : Type, relation X -> relation X -> Prop
semi_commute : forall X : Type, relation X -> relation X -> Prop
confluent : forall X : Type, relation X -> Prop
set = fun X : Type => X -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments set _%type_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : BinNums.Z | Zpos : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.Z | Zneg : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinNums.Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments BinNums.Zneg _%positive_scope
Inductive star (X : Type) (R : relation X) : relation X := star_refl : forall x : X, star R x x | S_star : forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> star R x z Arguments star [X]%type_scope Arguments star_refl [X]%type_scope Arguments S_star [X]%type_scope [R y] _ [z]
Record equivalence (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) : Prop := Build_equivalence { equiv_refl : Relation_Definitions.reflexive A R; equiv_trans : Relation_Definitions.transitive A R; equiv_sym : Relation_Definitions.symmetric A R } Arguments Relation_Definitions.equivalence _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Definitions.Build_equivalence _%type_scope
